snippet: When President Ronald Reagan nominated Anthony M. Kennedy to the Supreme Court, few could have imagined the esteem Justice Kennedy would one day earn among advocates of gay rights.
abstract: Supreme Court Justice Anthony M Kennedy is emerging as most important judicial champion of gay rights in nation’s history; he has written three landmark opinions on subject, including overturning ban on federal benefits for married same-sex couples; Kennedy was not always a supporter of gay rights but has changed due to his moderate social views, gay friends and belief in following foreign courts, which have expanded gay rights.
lead_paragraph: When President Ronald Reagan nominated Anthony M. Kennedy to the Supreme Court, few could have imagined the esteem Justice Kennedy would one day earn among advocates of gay rights.

headline.main: Surprising Friend of Gay Rights in a High Place
headline.print_headline: Surprising Friend of the Gay Rights Movement in the Highest of Places
